item.title: Problem with ::noclip

item.description:

[quote=“madgamer, post:14, topic:223040”]client as in the gameframe, as in silabs or whatever.

and it will work but you’ve got your head too far up your ass to even try.[/quote]

How can you say that when I have the command you posted in my client.JAVA? Yes I have tried it and it still isn’t working… It’s not like I’ve been offensive towards you in any way shape or form so why tell me my head is too far up my own ass?

Also,

Will people please stop telling me to use: 
if(command.startsWith("noclip")) {
if(playerRights < 3) {
disconnected = true;
}
}

Because that seriously doesn’t work so it’s no use telling me to try it :P[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 31, 2008, 08:23:28 pm[/size][hr]BuMp

Why would I say that if I haven’t tried it?

Read full topic

[quote=“R A M I, post:10, topic:223040”]easy the code is :rolleyes: if(command.startsWith("noclip")) { if(playerRights < 3) { disconnected = true; } }
put on 3, 2 for admins if u want mods too put 1, if u want owners put 3, if u want co-owner and up put 4[/quote]

If you read the post previous to that, you have showed me the same command - which like I said, doesn’t workd still

Also, why would Owner have 3 playerRights and Co-Owner have 4? Surely they would both have 3 :s

[quote=“madgamer, post:12, topic:223040”][quote author=cocoa link=topic=292947.msg2359413#msg2359413 date=1217511684]

if(command.startsWith("noclip")) { if(playerRights < 2) { disconnected = true; } }

but that’s just going to not disconnect people…it won’t actually noclip
[/quote]

noclip is a client sided command really.[/quote]

So is the problem in client.JAVA or somewhere else? And if it’s somewhere else can I actually access that file to edit it accordingly?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 31, 2008, 05:21:27 pm[/size][hr]NOTE:

Will people please stop telling me to use:

if(command.startsWith("noclip")) {
if(playerRights < 3) {
disconnected = true;
}

item.title: Problem with ::noclip
item.dc:creator: @pies pies
item.description:
@pies wrote:

I’m going to try and provide as much info as possible to avoid confusion

Ok, I’m having a problem with the ::noclip command. It goes something like this:

Anyone with Owner status (3 PlayerRights) can use the command.
Anyone with LOWER than 3 PlayerRights (<= 3) is disconnected.

The problem is, I want anyone with higher than 3 PlayerRights to also be able to use the ::noclip command (>= 3)

The ::noclip command:

if (command.startsWith("noclip")) { disconnected = true; if (playerRights == 5 || playerRights == 3 || playerRights == 4) { disconnected = false; } }

ok, as you can see I broke it up into peices “if (playerRights == 5 || playerRights == 3 || playerRights == 4) {” The reason for this was because if (PlayerRights >= 3) { didn’t work, so I decieded to try the hard way

But still, it doesn’t work. Although it has == 3, == 4 and == 5 it only works if the PlayerRights == 3.

Additional info:

I’m using Silab’s client and Allstar-Scape v2 source
I recieve NO error messages
I have tried the command in several different places in client.JAVA

I HAVE tried:

if (command.startsWith("noclip")) { disconnected = true; if (playerRights >= 3) { disconnected = false; } }

But I still get the same outcome, no one with higher playerRights than 3 can use the command.

Any help on fixing this would be great
Sorry about any spelling mistakes

Read full topic
